page.title: 06Methodists in Colden Common
page.content: There has been a Methodist Church in the village for 120 years.The ministry is shared with Chandlers Ford and the minister is resident in that settlement,a fact he regrets. This is a very active church with 80 adults and children attending regularly,rising to 110 on festivals. Membership has risen from 11 in 1978 to 46 in 1985. The Church also organises a number of clubs and societies for all ages, including Boy's Brigade,Brownies and Guides,Youth Club and Women's Club. Like his Anglican counterpart,the minister stresses the need for church involvement in people's lives, providing worship and fellowship for all members of the community.
